personalInfo.clubAffl: Raven GC at South Mountain (Phoenix, Arizona); Ledgeview G&CC (Abbotsford, British Columbia, Canada)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Subject to second reshuffle (first eight events)
tourBios.curYearHigh: Posted four sub-par scores at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach to claim a share of fifth place with Andres Romero and 2013 Puerto Rico Open champion, Scott Brown.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Posted five top-10s on PGA TOUR Canada to finish seventh on the Order of Merit and gain exemption into the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament Finals...Opened the season in June with a T4 (Times Colonist Island Savings Open), a T2 (Dakota Dunes Open) and a T6 (The Syncrude Boreal)...Added a T7 at the ATB Financial Classic. Picked up a fifth-place finish at the Wildfire Invitational. Made eight cuts in nine starts...Won five consecutive events on the Vancouver Golf Tour...Played steady golf at PGA West (69-70-72-67-68-67) to finish T11 at Q-School Finals.

 2012: Posted three top-10s, including a season-best T3 at the ATB Financial Classic on PGA TOUR Canada. Missed just one cut on PGA TOUR Canada...Missed the cut at the RBC Canadian Open...Missed the cut in his lone Web.com Tour start, at the BMW Charity Pro-Am.

 2011: Received six exemptions into PGA TOUR Canada events and earned enough money to gain full status for 2012...Played in two PGA TOUR events, missing the cut at both the Crowne Plaza Invitational and the RBC Canadian Open...Shot rounds of 71-70 but missed the cut at the Web.com Tour's Utah Championship.

 2010: Made his Canadian Tour debut at the Desert Dunes Classic, where he finished T21.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was a member of two provincial championship teams, winning the individual title once...Won the 2006 Canadian Junior Championship by a record 11 strokes...Was the 2007 Canadian Amateur champion...Qualified for the 2008 U.S. Open at Torrey Pines (missed cut)...Was low amateur at the 2009 U.S. Open at Bethpage State Park (T36)...Shared runner-up individual honors as a sophomore at the 2008 NCAA Championship...Was ranked No. 1 in the R&A's World Amateur Golf Ranking for 21 straight weeks (June-November 2009) and subsequently won the Mark H. McCormack Medal...Won four individual titles while at the University of Washington...Earned honorable mention All-American honors in 2008 (sophomore) and first-team All-American recognition in 2009 and 2010...Won the 2010 Ben Hogan Award given annually to the best amateur/collegiate player...Was runner-up at the 2009 U.S. Amateur Public Links Championship...Named Canada's top amateur golfer in 2009...Made his PGA TOUR debut at the 2008 U.S. Open (missed cut). A month later, made his first PGA TOUR cut, at the RBC Canadian Open (T53).
tourBios.personal: Attended Yale Secondary School in Abbotsford, British Columbia...Older brother, Josh, played golf at UTEP...First golf memory was playing in Fiji for the Aaron Baddeley Championship...If not a professional golfer, would be a college coach...Was selected to carry the Olympic Torch in advance of the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver...Favorite course played is Sahalee CC...Favorite team as a kid was the Toronto Blue Jays. Is now a big Seattle Seahawks' fan...Favorite TV show is "Criminal Minds" and movie is "The Shawshank Redemption."...Favorite entertainer is OneRepublic...Favorite book is The Perks of Being a Wallflower...Favorite food is Froot Loops...Favorite athletes are Roger Federer, Peyton Manning and Michael Jordan...Favorite city is Vancouver...Favorite gadget is his range finder...Would like to trade places with the U.S. President for a day "to read the book of secrets"...Dream foursome would include Ben Hogan, Moe Norman and Buddha...Not many people know he attended a Backstreet Boys concert in 2009...Bucket list includes seeing the Great Wall of China and the Egyptian Pyramids...Supports The First Tee...If featured in a prominent magazine, it would be Time as "it means I did something substantial outside of golf."....First-tee introduction song would be the "Rudy" theme song...Twitter name is @ntaylorgolf59.

tourBios.curYrHigh: Posted four sub-par scores at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach to claim a share of fifth place with Andres Romero and 2013 Puerto Rico Open champion, Scott Brown.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Posted four sub-par scores at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach to claim a share of fifth place with Andres Romero and 2013 Puerto Rico Open champion, Scott Brown.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: The TOUR rookie made 16 cuts in 27 starts through the Wyndham Championship, highlighted by his first career TOUR victory, to finish inside the top 125 and advance to the Playoffs at No. 102. His T53 finish at The Barclays left him just outside the top 100, at No. 101, keeping him from advancing to the following week's Deutsche Bank Championship...In November 2014, began the final round of the Sanderson Farms Championship four strokes off John Rollins' 14-under lead. Recorded eight birdies Sunday en route to a 6-under 66 that resulted in a two-stroke win. In only his 13th career TOUR start, earned his first career PGA TOUR victory at age 26 years, 6 months, 26 days. Victory was also his first top-10 TOUR finish. Became the first rookie to win on TOUR since Chesson Hadley won the 2014 Puerto Rico Open. Is the first Canadian-born player to win on the PGA TOUR since Mike Weir (2007 Frys.com Open). Broke a string of 10 consecutive American winners at the Sanderson Farms Championship, with the last international winner England's Luke Donald in 2002. 

2013-14: Finished the season playing in 24 of the Web.com Tour's 25 tournaments. Had three top-10s and five top-25s, while making 13 cuts...First top-10 came in March at the Panama Claro Championship, where he carded three consecutive rounds of 69. Birdies on his final two holes Sunday resulted in a 67 and T6 finish...Missed eight cuts over a 10-event stretch in May, June and July, finishing no better than T51 and dropping him from 45th in earnings to 95th...Second top-10 came in early August at the Price Cutter Charity Championship, thanks to rounds of 67-70-66-67 (18 under). His T9 finish moved him into 66th position on the money list...Later in August, was 74th heading to Portland and the final Regular Season event, and in a precarious position to qualify for the Web.com Tour Finals. A T26 finish left him 69th, allowing him to advance in his quest for a PGA TOUR card...Opened the Finals with a T9 at the Hotel Fitness Championship. Started the final round T26 and moved into the top 10 (T9) with a 66. Collected a check for $27,000...Followed with a T27 at next week's Chiquita Classic...Came to season's finale, the Web.com Tour Championship, very much on the bubble for his TOUR card with $33,535 in Finals' earnings...Left the best for last. Fired a 7-under-par 63 on TPC Sawgrass' Dye's Valley Course on the final day of the Web.com Tour Championship to finish T21 and nail down PGA TOUR membership for the first time.

2013: Posted five top-10s on PGA TOUR Canada to finish seventh on the Order of Merit and gain exemption into the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament Finals...Opened the season in June with a T4 (Times Colonist Island Savings Open), a T2 (Dakota Dunes Open) and a T6 (The Syncrude Boreal)...Added a T7 at the ATB Financial Classic. Picked up a fifth-place finish at the Wildfire Invitational. Made eight cuts in nine starts...Won five consecutive events on the Vancouver Golf Tour...Played steady golf at PGA West (69-70-72-67-68-67) to finish T11 at Q-School Finals.

 2012: Posted three top-10s, including a season-best T3 at the ATB Financial Classic on PGA TOUR Canada. Missed just one cut on PGA TOUR Canada...Missed the cut at the RBC Canadian Open...Missed the cut in his lone Web.com Tour start, at the BMW Charity Pro-Am.

 2011: Received six exemptions into PGA TOUR Canada events and earned enough money to gain full status for 2012...Played in two PGA TOUR events, missing the cut at both the Crowne Plaza Invitational and the RBC Canadian Open...Shot rounds of 71-70 but missed the cut at the Web.com Tour's Utah Championship.

2010: Made his Canadian Tour debut at the Desert Dunes Classic, where he finished T21.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T5th at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T77th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA TOUR.
